review.title: Great hotel, right in the heart of the city
review.reviewText: This isn't the fanciest of hotels, but for the price- it is way worth the stay! Great location, very central and close to everything. We used Uber to go almost everywhere and thanks to where we stayed, traveling around downtown was so affordable. Comfortable beds, clean rooms, attentive staff. Walkable distance to Polk Street which has an amazing nightlife, and plenty of awesome restaurants. I would absolutely stay again!

review.title: An excellent convenient and affordable hotel
review.reviewText: This was my second stay at the Opal. The staff is attentive and friendly. The rooms are clean and spacious enough. The beds are very comfortable, a real pleasure after running all over the city during the day.
review.positiveRemarks: The hotel's guests are not party people.it's a quiet hotel where you can relax and get a good night's after a long day. Efficient, attentive staff.
review.locationRemarks:
Close  to a ton of ethnic food restaurants on Geary st. 
You can walk to Union Square and the Civic Center - symphony, the Opera , and Asian Museum.

review.title: Stinking hotel
review.reviewText: Room was not ready when we came. The sink is clog and the room stinks. Even the hallways in that hotel stink. The only thing that smells good in that hotel is the lobby. Maybe they sprayed a lot of air freshener to cover up the stinking smell of overall hotel . Even the comforter they gave us is too old and stinks.

review.title: Dated hotel with good location
review.reviewText: Stayed in SF downtown for official business and vacation too. The Opal is near two bus lines and near many restaurants. It's like staying in an old European hotel. The furnishings are elegant but dated. The carpeting in the hallways has an unpleasant odor and the bathroom vent gave me a headache because it's way too noisy. Otherwise, it's a pretty good hotel.
review.negativeRemarks: Hallway carpets stink and the bathroom vent is unpleasantly noisy
review.locationRemarks: There are many restaurants nearby and two bus lines to choose from. Civic Center is walking distance.

review.title: Great hotel, clean rooms, fantastic staff
review.reviewText: Fantastic all round. The breakfast was great and loved it was available to 10, for those sleep ins. The staff were friendly and helpful and it was a short walk to the shops
review.positiveRemarks: close to Union Square, great price for San Fran, close to great eateries!

review.title: Old hotel
review.reviewText: The hotel needs to be renovated as everything is outdated. There were lots of homeless nearby which gave us an unsafe feeling. Moreover, it is far from the Bart subway.

review.title: Decent and convenient
review.reviewText: Clean and convenient hotel about 10 minutes from attractions like Exploratorium, Fishermans Wharf, the opera, and cute Hayes Valley.  Expensive for what it is but that is San Francisco market rates. Free breakfast.

review.title: OK hotel for an OK price
review.reviewText:
The Opal is a fine hotel for downtown SF. It's not great, it's not terrible. My ground floor room was very very noisy. Road noise, pedestrian noise, construction noise. I spend at least 25% of the year on the road and can do with some fairly noisy rooms. This was a bit too much. Noise from neighboring rooms and the hallway pretty loud too. That goes with the territory of older SF hotels mind you, nothing special there. Zero hot water was available the night I checked in, it was ok the morning after though.

Don't let the breakfast factor into your decision, it's some bread, toasters, and stale pastries. Plenty of great breakfast in the area that will be a little more filling.

Would I stay here again? Yea probably. The price was right and the city can get pretty expensive at times. Would I recommend it to someone on vacation? No. Spend a bit more and get something a little nicer.
review.negativeRemarks: Hotel very dated, cleanliness only ok. Very very noisy.

review.reviewText: The hotel has a very good location the room where I stayed had a nice view
Hotel room was very spacious and clean. The staff was friendly. The one thing I didnt like was the price of parking $48 is way too much.

managementResponses.response: Thank you for your comments. We are an old hotel, 108 years old, and are in the process of upgrading many of our facilities. Maybe the next time you are in the city, you can try one of our renovated rooms. Because of our age, we do have rooms of various shapes and sizes, but we do what we can to try and give our guests a pleasant stay here. We cannot improve without the comments of our guests, so I appreciate you taking the time to let us know.

review.title: A small room, a bit tight on space, clean enough
review.reviewText: Very small room but the space was clean enough... feels like an old hotel.  Carpet and sheets are a bit worn but everything worked.

managementResponses.response: I am sorry to hear that the room was too small. Did you have one of our double bedrooms? We do try to accommodate our guests needs in regards to rooms and many are different sizes and configurations due to the building being over 100 years old. Thank you for addressing this to our attention. The best way for us to improve is through the comments and suggestions of our guests!

review.title: Not worth the daily rate
review.reviewText: Too small for 4 people, uncomfortable, Only one side of the room was able to watch tv and AC only reach one side as well, I will not be staying there again.

managementResponses.response: Angela: Thank you for your comments regarding your stay at the Opal. I know parking can seem expensive, as it is around the city, but we do try to price it lower than most and our parking is at the hotel and we do provide secured parking with 24 hour in and out privileges, but we do have limited spaces. I am sorry to hear that your car was broken into on the street. It is a huge problem around the whole city and we try to warn our guests of this issue. Even if someone finds us too expensive, we will try to suggest other facilities in the area because we hate to hear stories of like what happened with you. Thank you for letting us know what happened. We do hope the rest of your stay in San Francisco was good.

review.title: Get car garage!
review.reviewText: Hotel is in downtown area , is mostly clean , just carpet had a rusty odor , comfy bed . Bad thing is that there is not parking near hotel and hotel offer it but is so small and is first come first serve. Get car garage even prices are too too high but they secure really good your car . We didnt get it because we tought is to expensive for one night and left car to one of streets next day got suprise that a homeless broke into the car , got a broken window. didnt took anything from car , we had chips only and everything was there, homeless wasnt hungry just looking for something valuable or money

review.title: nice hotel, close to the union squer
review.reviewText:
nice hotle with good staff.
Unfortunately the area is not too good. The streets between the hotel and the union squer are full of homless and strange peoples. Daytime is ok but in the evening is not too good
review.positiveRemarks: Good for couple day stay and close to the cable car and chine town
review.negativeRemarks: I missed some sausages or scrambled egg from the continental breakfast
review.locationRemarks:
Unfortunately the area is not too good. The streets between the hotel and the union squer are full of homless and stranger
Cable car and chine town

review.title: Nice Hotel
review.reviewText: The hotel was nice considering it was 108 yrs old. Staff was friendly and the rooms were comfortable. My only complaint is that there was a lamp between two double beds that was way too big and everytime you turned over you hit your head.  Would be nice if there was a sitting chair in the room and the traffic was loud all night but to be expected.. it's SF. Continental breakfast was very good. I would definitely stay here again.

review.title: Nice hotel at a great price
review.reviewText: We really enjoyed our stay at The Opal.  The room was very clean, and the beds were very comfortable after long days of sight seeing.  The breakfast was good enough to get you going for the day.  The staff was very friendly and helpful!  The price was very reasonable compared to other hotels in the same area.

review.title: It's a place to sleep
review.reviewText:
We booked the room with 2 queen beds and a pull out sofa bed.   The restroom door kept  getting stuck and had to be opened from the room side.  The carpet are outdated and old. 

It was a place a to sleep

review.title: Nice hotel. Very friendly staff.
review.reviewText: Good room. Comfy bed. Breakfast buffet needs a bit more of a upgrade with choices.

review.title: Good San Fransisco Budget Hotel
review.reviewText: I stayed at the Opal SF for two nights with my family after finishing a tour of Redwoods & Yosemite National Parks. Although the lobby is very nice, the rooms are extremely basic (reminiscent of a motel), but safe and for the location, you can't beat the price. We were happy with the room, and it was a great option to explore San Fransisco a little without breaking the bank.
